description.narrative: The project #Enhancing capacity of Thematic Working Group (TWG) under Conflict Transformation Theme# will contribute to strengthen Conflict Transformation programme in Pakistan by documenting learning#s of Peace My Right Campaign and enhancing capacity of Oxfam staff and implementing partners in programme development. The project period is one year. Project Overview: Oxfam Novib has existingprogramme on Conflict Transformation in Pakistan and under this programme as a part of efforts to initiate the concept of thematic working group; Oxfam Novib together with implementing partners organized TWG in 2013 and provided technical support in previous years related to programme development. This year the project provides opportunity to Oxfam Staff and implementing partners as a member of TWG to develop their capacity in programme development. This will lead to development of innovative and pragmatic concepts leading towards formulation of project proposals that address root casus of conflict under the conflict Transformation theme. One of the outputs of the project is to develop quality proposals together with Oxfam Staff and member organizations of the thematic working group. In this regard, a local consultant having expertise and skills in proposal development will be also hired to work with TWG to develop quality proposals by organizing thematic working group workshops. Outcomes and Outputs: Outcome Indicator: Strengthened CSOs: 05 CSOs increasingly participates in or initiate influencing and advocacy efforts to contribute to conflict transformation/address root causes of conflict. Outcome Indicator: Oxfam more effective: 01 case where Oxfam Novib/partners implement recommendations derived from learning on conflict sensitivity. Output Indicator: 05 Organizations supported with means (financial, knowledge, skills, networks, training etc.) to strengthen capacity in specific areas Output Indicator: 01 Evidence products (track records, cases, evaluations etc.)produced that assess Oxfam Novib #s programmes and projects effectiveness and quality. The other major output of the project is to conduct research and document learning#s and best practices of Peace #My Right Campaign# and also identification of potential civil society organizations working on peace building/social cohesion in Sindh Province. For this a local consultant will be hired to conduct research on Peace My Right Campaign and also prepare report on identification of potential partners working on peace building/social cohesion. The learning#s of the Peace My Right Campaign will inform the programme development aspect of the Conflict Transformation Programme. Peace My Right Campaign: Oxfam Novib together with partners in 2011 launched campaign titled as #Peace MyRight# in Punjab and Sindh Provinces of Pakistan. Later on this campaign was also initiated in Khyber Pakhtunkhawa province as well. The objective of this campaign was to build peaceful society in Pakistan by promoting peace as a basic Human right. The specific objective was to empower people and bring them together across stereotypical ethnic, sectarian and religious identities to solve local and policy level issues that are negatively affecting their peace through non-violent means. Under this campaign several projects wereimplemented in 3 provinces i.e. Punjab, Khypber Pakhtunkhwa and several partners implemented projects contributing the overall goal of the project i.e. #Building on the learning#s of several years work Oxfam Novib and partners.# Implementing partners reported achievements and success stories.

participating-org.narrative:
Sojhla for Social Change as active part of peace movement in Pakistan as well as in South Asian Region was a partner in the Oxfam Novib#s Campaign #Peace My Right# and is currently an implementing partner in Citizens First project. Sojhla has also supported, local partners, in certain activities related to sustainable agriculture conducted by Oxfam#s Grow Campaign. Sojhla contributed all deliberations with relevant inputs and suggestions.
Sojhla for Social Change started working in 2002 with its set objectives regarding peace, gender mainstreaming and governance. However later on realizing the community needs it included the areas for intervention such as girls' education, livelihood as well as health preventive and curative measures through awarenessand primary level services. The focus of advocacy intervention areas by Sojhla mainly remained around promotion of primary education specially for girl child, livelihood promotion in flood and water logging area based on backward and forward linkages, women empowerment for self-reliant through Self-help group formation <(>&<)> cluster development, reduce the violent behaviour, domestic violence, children specially adolescent girl, creating employment opportunities through providing awareness regarding their skills and supporting their approach to markets, supported women farmers to raise their voice through collective interventions etc.
Sojhla has networking and interaction with national level advocacy groups and support organizations including peace, food security <(>&<)> climate change movements in South Asia. Sojhla actively participated in Pesticide Asia Network-Asia Pacific(PAN-AP), Civil Society Platform for Development and Effectiveness(CPDE), South Asian Peace initiatives. In addition it is observed fromSojhla reports that it has engaged relevant stake holdersin the campaigns and advocacy initiatives. The important strength of Sojhla is visible from its reports about its linkages and interaction with community groups. Cultural action is also important component of Sojhla strategy.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
